question_sentence: The prime minister of which Melanesian country faces a no-confidence vote after 18 MPs defected from his coalition?
evidence: Finance minister Rainbo Paita, who was among the defectors, is the leading candidate to replace PM James Marape. Find out more about why Papua New Guinea is in turmoil in this week's episode of The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Mexico is anticipating depletion of its water supply by the end of which month?
evidence: Mexico faces the possibility of a "Day Zero", when taps connected to the main water system could run dry. The looming disaster is the product of "years of poor water management compounded by scarce rains" brought on by extended drought.

question_sentence: The latest episode of "Doctor Who"'s 14th season has been hailed as a "stone-cold classic". What is the episode called?
evidence: Despite Ncuti Gatwa's Time Lord being almost entirely absent from the action, sidekick Ruby Sunday carried an episode The Independent called a "five-star knockout".

question_sentence: Who did the Libertarian Party choose as its US presidential nominee?
evidence: The Libertarian Party selected activist Chase Oliver as its presidential nominee after a weekend convention that featured pitches by Donald Trump and Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Trump's bid for the nomination was met with scepticism, while Kennedy was seeking a "possible pathway" to ballot access.

question_sentence: According to a survey published this week, what is the most popular nickname for UK parents-to-be to give their baby bump?
evidence: Some of the more unusual choices to make the top 10 in the survey include "Mango", "Pickle" and "Bambi".

question_sentence: Once Major League Baseball finishes incorporating statistics from historic segregated leagues, who will overtake Ty Cobb’s batting average?
evidence: After the Negro League's 1920-1948 statistics have been incorporated into the MLB's record book, Homestead Grays powerhouse Josh Gibson will overtake Ty Cobb with a new batting average of .372 compared to Cobb’s .367, recognising Gibson as one of the greatest players of all time.

question_sentence: French far-right leader Marine Le Pen has proposed an alliance with which fellow right-winger to form a "supergroup" in the European Parliament?
evidence: Politico's latest Poll of Polls indicates that far-right representatives will outnumber the centrist European People's Party in the next European Parliament, although a united right-wing coalition seems unlikely. Here are five things to look out for at the EU elections on 6 June.

question_sentence: What significant event took place on Wednesday in South Africa?
choices: The inauguration of a new president
evidence: South Africans headed to the polls to vote on what could prove the most consequential election since the end of apartheid in the 1990s. Discontent with the ruling African National Congress threatens to end its 30-year political dominance.

question_sentence: On Monday, thousands of spectators gathered in rural Gloucestershire to watch what traditional annual contest, a fixture since 1826?
evidence: Every year hardy daredevils gather at the top of Cooper's Hill to chase a 7lb wheel of Double Gloucester down the steep hillside – sometimes incurring hair-raising injuries in the melee. Despite being a quintessentially English novelty event, this year's winners were German Tom Kopke and American Abby Lampe.

question_sentence: Which animal will be returning to the Smithsonian National Zoo in Washington?
evidence: China will be sending two giant two-year old pandas, Bao Li and Qing Bao, to Washington. The Smithsonian National Zoo can expect to receive the pandas before the end of the year, roughly a year after the zoo’s previous pandas returned to China.

question_sentence: Which state was impacted by widespread power outages caused by severe thunderstorms this week?
evidence: Hundreds of thousands of utility customers in Texas were without power this week after storms unleashed hurricane-force winds.

question_sentence: Former President Donald Trump's criminal hush money trial was heard by a panel of how many jurors?
evidence: A panel of 12 New Yorkers heard testimony about whether former President Donald Trump falsified business records related to a hush money payment to an adult film star before the 2016 election.

question_sentence: Which type of animal recently tested positive for H5N1 bird flu for the first time?
evidence: A group of alpacas on a farm in Idaho recently tested positive for H5N1 bird flu for the first time, according to the USDA. For more than two decades, H5N1 has primarily affected birds but research shows the virus is now infecting a wider variety of wild and farmed mammals.

question_sentence: Which Supreme Court justice is receiving mounting criticism about two controversial flags that have flown on their properties?
evidence: Supreme Court Justice Samuel Alito told lawmakers he will not recuse himself from cases involving the 2020 presidential election or the January 6, 2021, US Capitol riot despite concerns about two controversial flags that have flown on his properties.

question_sentence: What is causing some rivers in Alaska to change color from a clear blue to a rusty orange?
evidence: A new study shows rivers in Alaska are turning a rusty orange color due to an "unexpected consequence of climate change." Specifically, the discoloration is caused by the release of metals such as iron, zinc, copper, nickel and lead as permafrost thaws.

question_sentence: The world’s longest-serving flight attendant, Bette Nash, recently passed away at the age of 88. Which airline did she work for?
evidence: American Airlines issued a statement honoring the life of Bette Nash, the world's longest-serving flight attendant. She started the job in 1957 and spent nearly seven decades caring for customers with "warmth, dedication and unparalleled service," the airline said.

question_sentence: Which capital broke an all-time record-high temperature this week?
evidence: India’s capital territory of Delhi sweltered to its highest-ever temperature at 121.8 degrees Fahrenheit on Tuesday.

question_sentence: Which automaker issued a warning to thousands of vehicle owners over an airbag safety hazard?
evidence: More than 84,000 owners of older Nissan vehicles in the US were told to immediately stop driving their cars due to potential airbag inflators that can explode.

question_sentence: Which state could become the first to require schools to display the Ten Commandments in all classrooms?
evidence: According to a controversial new bill, every Louisiana classroom — from kindergarten through university level — would be required to display the Ten Commandments or risk losing state funding.

question_sentence: Which country recently returned a group of stolen artifacts worth more than $80 million to Italy?
evidence: Hundreds of trafficked valuables ranging from life-sized bronze statues to tiny Roman coins were confiscated in the US and returned to Italy.

question_sentence: What is the main charge against Hunter Biden in his upcoming gun trial?
choices: Lying on a federal form during a gun purchase

question_sentence: On June 3, 2024, a planetary alignment will occur. Which of the following statements about this event is correct?
choices: Only Mercury, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn will be visible to the naked eye
All planets will be visible to the naked eye.
The alignment will be visible only in the Southern Hemisphere
The alignment will last for several weeks

question_sentence: What unusual method was used to steal firearms from Miller’s Gun Center in Delaware?
choices: A helicopter was used to airlift the firearms.
Thieves tunneled into the store from underneath.
A flatbed truck was backed into the store’s front door.
The thieves used a boat to approach the store from a nearby river.

question_sentence: Which team won the 13th consecutive DIAA Girls Lacrosse championship in 2024?
What is the main goal of the new Mental Health & Resiliency Program set up by the Delaware State Fire Prevention Commission?
choices: To provide physical health services to firefighters and EMTs.
To provide direct, confidential mental health services to firefighters and EMTs.
To provide financial support to firefighters and EMTs.
To provide housing facilities to firefighters and EMTs.

question_sentence: What is the name of the new restaurant that opened in Rehoboth Beach, Delaware?
What is the future plan for the former Brandywine Country Club?
choices: It will be converted into a shopping mall.
It will likely become a 365-home project.
It will be renovated and reopened as a country club.
It will be turned into a public park.

question_sentence: How much funding was awarded by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to clean contaminants at downtown Dover redevelopment sites in 2024?
What significant action have the students and staff at Maj. George S. Welch Elementary School taken to honor World War II pilot George Welch?
choices: They have created a statue in his honor.
They have named the school after him.
They have reignited the campaign for Welch to be awarded the Congressional Medal of Honor.
They have written a book about his life.

question_sentence: What was the percentage increase in Delaware’s existing home sales (not new construction) from April 2023 to April 2024?
